greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest odd prime base q such that p^4 divides q^(p-1) - 1, where p = prime(n).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
W. Keller and J. Richstein Fermat quotients that are divisible by p.
maple: f:= proc(n) local p, r, S,i,s,t;
if t::odd and isprime(t) then return t fi
program: (PARI) { a(n) = local(p,x,y); if(n==1,return(17)); p=prime(n); x=znprimroot(p^4)^(p^3); vecsort( vector(p-1,i, y=lift(x^i);while(!isprime(y),y+=p^4);y ) )[1] } - _Max Alekseyev_, May 30 2007
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Nov 29 2006
